solution_line_template: Before lunch, the cook had used {used_before_lunch_fraction}*{initial_carrots} = <<{used_before_lunch_fraction}*{initial_carrots}={carrots_used_before_lunch}>>{carrots_used_before_lunch} carrots.

The number of remaining carrots after the cook used 2/5 of them is {initial_carrots}-{carrots_used_before_lunch} = <<{initial_carrots}-{carrots_used_before_lunch}={remaining_carrots_after_lunch}>>{remaining_carrots_after_lunch}.

The cook had used {used_end_of_day_fraction}*{remaining_carrots_after_lunch} = <<{used_end_of_day_fraction}*{remaining_carrots_after_lunch}={carrots_used_end_of_day}>>{carrots_used_end_of_day} of the remaining carrots by the end of the day.

The number of carrots that the cook did not use that day is {remaining_carrots_after_lunch}-{carrots_used_end_of_day} = <<{remaining_carrots_after_lunch}-{carrots_used_end_of_day}={carrots_not_used}>>{carrots_not_used}.
